column1: Algés (Portuguese pronunciation: [aɫˈʒɛʃ]) is a former civil parish in the municipality of Oeiras
column4: the parish merged into the new parish Algés
column5: Linda-a-Velha e Cruz Quebrada-Dafundo. The population in 2011 was 22
column7: in an area of 1.98 km². The parish is located near the Tagus river
column8: between the town of Oeiras and the capital city of Lisbon. It is also a part of the Greater Lisbon Area. It is mostly a residential suburb.

column1: Algés was elevated to a town on August 16
column3: and the parish was officially created on June 11
column5: after separating from the parish of Carnaxide.
